trans-unit.source: Using the Dropbox Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Dropbox Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Dropbox Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Dropbox Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Dropbox Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Dropbox Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to Dropbox account to upload or download files.
trans-unit.target: Connect to Dropbox account to upload or download files.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data.

trans-unit.source: You can add the Dropbox connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: You can add the Dropbox connector to your business workflow and process data as part of this workflow within a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of a new message.
trans-unit.target: A Trigger starts a new instance based on a specific event, like the arrival of a new message.

trans-unit.source: An Action is the result, like after receiving a new message, then upload the file to Dropbox.
trans-unit.target: An Action is the result, like after receiving a new message, then upload the file to Dropbox.

trans-unit.source: The Dropbox connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.
trans-unit.target: The Dropbox connector can be used as an action in a logic app and supports data in JSON and XML formats.

trans-unit.source: The Dropbox connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:
trans-unit.target: The Dropbox connector has the following Triggers and Actions available:

trans-unit.source: Triggers
trans-unit.target: Triggers

trans-unit.source: Actions
trans-unit.target: Actions

trans-unit.source: None
trans-unit.target: None

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Delete File<html></html><html></html>Get File<html></html><html></html>Upload File<html></html><html></html>List Files<html></html><html></html>
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Delete File<html></html><html></html>Get File<html></html><html></html>Upload File<html></html><html></html>List Files<html></html><html></html>

trans-unit.source: Create an Dropbox connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create an Dropbox connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Dropbox Connector”, select it, and select Create.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Dropbox Connector”, select it, and select Create.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:

trans-unit.source: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed
trans-unit.target: Location - choose the geographic location where you would like the connector to be deployed

trans-unit.source: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in
trans-unit.target: Subscription - choose a subscription you want this connector to be created in

trans-unit.source: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside
trans-unit.target: Resource group - select or create a resource group where the connector should reside

trans-unit.source: App Service plan - select or create a web hosting plan
trans-unit.target: App Service plan - select or create a web hosting plan

trans-unit.source: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector
trans-unit.target: Pricing tier - choose a pricing tier for the connector

trans-unit.source: Name - give a name for your Dropbox Connector
trans-unit.target: Name - give a name for your Dropbox Connector

trans-unit.source: Select Create.
trans-unit.target: Select Create.

trans-unit.source: Using the Dropbox Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Dropbox Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Dropbox connector as an action for your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Dropbox connector as an action for your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: In your logic app, open Triggers and Actions to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:
trans-unit.target: In your logic app, open Triggers and Actions to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow:

trans-unit.source: The Dropbox connector is listed in the gallery:
trans-unit.target: The Dropbox connector is listed in the gallery:

trans-unit.source: Select the Dropbox connector to automatically add in the designer.
trans-unit.target: Select the Dropbox connector to automatically add in the designer.

trans-unit.source: Select Authorize, enter your credentials, and select Allow:
trans-unit.target: Select Authorize, enter your credentials, and select Allow:

trans-unit.source: You can now use Dropbox connector in the flow.
trans-unit.target: You can now use Dropbox connector in the flow.

trans-unit.source: You can use the Dropbox action "upload File" to upload a file to your Dropbox account:
trans-unit.target: You can use the Dropbox action "upload File" to upload a file to your Dropbox account:

trans-unit.source: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:
trans-unit.target: Configure the input properties for "Upload File" action as follows:

trans-unit.source: File Path - Specify the destination Dropbox file path of the file to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: File Path - Specify the destination Dropbox file path of the file to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Example: Photos/image.png
trans-unit.target: Example: Photos/image.png

trans-unit.source: Content - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: Content - Specifies the content of the file to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Often, this will come from a previous step in your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Often, this will come from a previous step in your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding - Specify none or base64.
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding - Specify none or base64.

trans-unit.source: Overwrite - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists.
trans-unit.target: Overwrite - Specify "true" to overwrite the file if it already exists.

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>What are Logic Apps?</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at <link><linkText>Connectors and API Apps Reference</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: See <link><linkText>Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors</linkText><title></title></link>.
